indicators.justification:
Section 8 of the Clean Air Law, 2008 and Section 6A of the Freedom of Information Law, 1998 together with the Second Legislation Freedom of Information (providing information on the environment for public inspection), 2009 require publication Of each environmental sampling conducted. According to section 4 of the sub-regulation, it is obligatory to publish the information on the Internet for public inspection to be done in a manner that will ensure its availability, retention, the ability to retrieve the information and produce output from it. Section 15 of the Clean Air Act requires emission permit holders to conduct sampling.

Accordingly, the Ministry of Environmental Protection and the Local Environmental Association centralize the information and make it public. Since there is no concrete regulation on how to advertise, it is done in many forms, sometimes in duplicate. In addition, the firm operates tools (maps and dashboards) for easy and accessible presentation of the information.

The main site for publishing air data is:
https://www.svivaaqm.net/

There is also a dashboard of the data in this site:
https://analytics.sviva.gov.il/QvAJAXZfc/opendoc.htm?document=Model.qvw


(1) The Clean Air Law, 2008 https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A7_%D7%90%D7%95%D7%95%D7%99%D7%A8_%D7%A0%D7%A7%D7%99
(2) The Freedom of Information Law, 1998 https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A7_%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A4%D7%A9_%D7%94%D7%9E%D7%99%D7%93%D7%A2
(3) The Second Legislation Freedom of Information (providing information on the environment for public inspection), 2009  https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%AA%D7%A7%D7%A0%D7%95%D7%AA_%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A4%D7%A9_%D7%94%D7%9E%D7%99%D7%93%D7%A2_(%D7%94%D7%A2%D7%9E%D7%93%D7%AA_%D7%9E%D7%99%D7%93%D7%A2_%D7%A2%D7%9C_%D7%90%D7%99%D7%9B%D7%95%D7%AA_%D7%94%D7%A1%D7%91%D7%99%D7%91%D7%94_%D7%9C%D7%A2%D7%99%D7%95%D7%9F_%D7%94%D7%A6%D7%99%D7%91%D7%95%D7%A8)

evidence.title: The Second Legislation Freedom of Information (providing information on the environment for public inspection), 2009

indicators.justification: There is no binding regulatory framework for the publication of endangered species and ecosystems. Accordingly, the government publication of this information is voluntary and therefore there is a problem in relying on its reliability and timeliness. In addition, there are NGOs that collect and present information according to their areas of activity.

indicators.justification:
There are no databases about climate vulnerability information.

The Geological Survey of Israel coordinates most of the activity. However, even on a dedicated page for the institute's databases, there are only explanatory documents or research proposals. All databases relating to land and sea risks, insofar as they exist, are not made public.

indicators.justification:
Section 39 of the Associations Law, 1980 defines the obligations of the directors of the associations and the powers of the Registrar of Associations or the Minister of Justice to open the information about the associations to the public.
https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A7_%D7%94%D7%A2%D7%9E%D7%95%D7%AA%D7%95%D7%AA

Sections 43-44 of the Companies Law, 1999 define the obligations of the owners of companies and the powers of the Registrar of Companies or the Minister of Justice to open the information on companies to the public.
https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A7_%D7%94%D7%97%D7%91%D7%A8%D7%95%D7%AA

Information about associations is displayed on the Guidestar website for free. Each corporation has a dedicated page with financial details, names of officers and general information about the corporation.
https://www.guidestar.org.il

In addition, the information about the corporations can be downloaded from the site as an XLS file, without links to the documents and without information about the officers.
https://www.guidestar.org.il/sfc/servlet.shepherd/document/download/0690800000GqK2KAAV

Basic information about companies like company name (also in English), company number and address can be viewed for free
https://ica.justice.gov.il/GenericCorporarionInfo/SearchCorporation?unit=8

Shareholder information must be purchased as a company file, for each company separately, and is received as a collection of documents submitted by the company over the years to the Registrar of Companies.

(1) The Associations Law, 1980
https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A7_%D7%94%D7%A2%D7%9E%D7%95%D7%AA%D7%95%D7%AA


(2) The Companies Law, 1999
https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A7_%D7%94%D7%97%D7%91%D7%A8%D7%95%D7%AA

indicators.justification:
Section 3 of the Statistics Ordinance 1972 sets out the functions of the Central Bureau of Statistics, including the collection and publication of information in Israel. Accordingly, and in accordance with international coordination, the Central Bureau of Statistics publishes the information. This information is in a convenient format for processing. However, most of the data is in separate Excel files for each period (usually annually) and not as a bulk bulk.

In addition, the Ministry of Health as a regulator in the field collects the information from the hospitals and presents various surgeries. Therefore, high-resolution information such as months of pregnancy, age, education, etc., is found only in processed information in the Ministry of Health. This information is published as a report and not as a database.

(1) The Statistics Ordinance 1972   https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%A4%D7%A7%D7%95%D7%93%D7%AA_%D7%94%D7%A1%D7%98%D7%98%D7%99%D7%A1%D7%98%D7%99%D7%A7%D7%94

Mortality information includes data about age, sex and/or gender, geographic location, and cause of death.
Birth information includes data about sex and/or assigned gender of child, gestational age, and birth weight.
Birth information includes data about live-birth order and interval between last and previous live births to mother.
Birth information includes data about place of occurrence, place of usual residence of mother, and month of occurrence.
Birth information includes data about place of registration and month of registration.
Birth information includes data about age, educational attainment, and ethnic and/or national group of mother.
Birth information includes data about age of father and place of usual residence.
Birth information includes data about site of delivery, attendant at birth, and month in which prenatal care began.
Dataset is available free of charge.
Data is openly licensed.
Data is available in all the country’s official or national languages. If the country has no official or national languages, data is available in the major languages of the country.

indicators.justification:
The regulation of land uses in Israel is based on the Planning and Building Law, 1965. This information is by default found in the planning and construction files of the planning authorities. It is not accessible to the public as a database.

The only public information is information on the definition of territories such as national packers or government institutions. 

Currently there is a project called "Blue Lines" designed to centralize this information but in practice it is still inaccessible, certainly not as a database. There are some local authorities that you can view the information details according to search fields such as adress, name of the land owner and thins like that.

(1) The Planning and Building Law, 1965

indicators.justification:
The budget data has always been published because the state budget is legally approved by parliament. Publishing the budget in Excel files is an internal initiative of the Budget Division in the Ministry of Finance and without binding regulation.
The procurement reports are published in accordance with the procedure of the Government Unit for Freedom of Information in the Ministry of Justice

https://www.gov.il/he/departments/news/expense_report

responses.response_text: Data is available from government, or because of government actions.
responses.subquestion_text: Is this data available online in any form?
There is structured data available on the executive budget proposal in gross terms, including spending on annual and multi-annual investment projects.
There is structured data available on amended budgets (when applicable) or amendments of the enacted budget.
There is structured data available on the approved or enacted budget in gross terms, including spending on annual and multi-annual investment projects.
There is structured data about government budget execution or spending, in gross terms and on an accrual basis, including spending in annual and multi-annual investment projects.
There is structured data about the government's extrabudgetary funds spending, in gross terms and on an accrual basis.
There is structured data about the government's social security spending, in gross terms and on an accrual basis.
There is structured data about public corporations' spending, in gross terms and on an accrual basis.
Budget entries have administrative classifications to an internationally agreed standard.
Budget entries have economic classifications to an internationally agreed standard.
Budget entries have functional classifications to an internationally agreed standard.
Budget entries have program classifications according to an internationally agreed standard.
Information about individual financial transactions or expenditures is available at the most disaggregated level of the economic classification level.
Data is disaggregated by cross-cutting programs, or issues such as SDGs, climate action, gender budgeting, etc,
The data contains common identifiers to connect budget and budget performance data.
The data contains identifiers that can be used to connect budget data with data on major projects (e.g., infrastructure construction) and procurement processes.
Dataset is available free of charge.
Data is openly licensed.
Data is available in all the country’s official or national languages. If the country has no official or national languages, data is available in the major languages of the country.
There are accessible and open official tools available to help users explore data.
Data is timely and updated.
Historical data is available that allows users to track change over time.
Data is provided in machine-readable format(s)
The machine-readable dataset is available as a whole

indicators.justification:
Section 7 of the Public Service (asset declaration), 2016 Act provides for complete secrecy over the asset declaration of civil servants. Beyond that, the concept of the right to privacy in Israel takes information about assets seriously, and therefore even without any concrete regulation, information about capital and assets is not provided or published.

(1) The Public Service Law (asset declaration), 2016

https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A7_%D7%A9%D7%99%D7%A8%D7%95%D7%AA_%D7%94%D7%A6%D7%99%D7%91%D7%95%D7%A8_(%D7%94%D7%A6%D7%94%D7%A8%D7%AA_%D7%94%D7%95%D7%9F)

indicators.justification:
The Registrar of Parties is the regulator of the activities of the parties. The parties are obliged to submit regular reports to him and he publishes on his website in the form of collections of PDF documents.

During election periods, the State Comptroller is responsible for much tighter budgetary control, and the parties report donations or guarantees to him, within a digital information system in which the data is public.

(1) Financial statements of parties
https://www.justice.gov.il/Units/RasutHataagidim/units/RashamMiflagot/Services/Pages/AllParties.aspx?WPID=WPQ8&PN=2

(2) Donations and guarantees to parties

indicators.justification:
Section 5 of the Freedom of Information Act, 1998 defines the obligation to publish an annual report.
Section 7 of the Freedom of Information regulation, 1999 defines the details that should be published regarding RTI performance.

This information must be published on the website of the public authority but without a definition of format and form.

The Government's Freedom of Information Guidelines regarding RTI performance reporting require online form reporting. These reports are published by the Freedom of Information Unit as a database. However, these guidelines apply to government officials only.

Recently, local authorities have also been asked to fill out these forms, but filling out the forms is voluntary

(1) The Freedom of Information Act, 1998

(3) The goverment decision 2950 from 2011: Implementation of the Freedom of Information Law, 1998: Increasing transparency in public authorities

indicators.justification:
The legal situation in Israel is that the parliament has state authority and the government has state legislative power. The validity of the laws and the secondary legislation is conditional on their publication and therefore a duty to publish has been created.
The main information available in Israel as a database in the field of public participation is about legislation and secondary legislation, and the information published at the stage of the legislative process is usually voluntary. The binding publication refers only to approved laws and sub-legislation.

(1) Knesset Rules of Procedure

indicators.justification:
The Tender Obligation Law, 1992 and the Second Legislation The Tender Obligation Act, 1993, requires the publication of tenders (section 15 of the sub-legislation) in the newspaper and on the Authority's website. In addition, sections 24A to 24E define the obligation to establish a website for the publication of tenders.
In addition, the procedure for publishing procurement reports requires all government ministries to publish quarterly procurement reports.

In the local authorities in accordance with parallel legislation - the Municipal Legislation (Tenders), 1988 there is an obligation to publish the tenders but there is no obligation to publish them online. Local authorities are required to publish on the Internet only cases of procurement not made through a tender (subject to an exemption granted by a special committee). However, the local authorities do not publish procurement reports and the procedure does not apply to them.

(1) The The Tender Obligation Law, 1992   https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A7_%D7%97%D7%95%D7%91%D7%AA_%D7%94%D7%9E%D7%9B%D7%A8%D7%96%D7%99%D7%9D
(2) The Second Legislation The Tender Obligation Act, 1993   https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%AA%D7%A7%D7%A0%D7%95%D7%AA_%D7%97%D7%95%D7%91%D7%AA_%D7%94%D7%9E%D7%9B%D7%A8%D7%96%D7%99%D7%9D
(3) The Municipal Legislation (Tenders), 1988   https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%AA%D7%A7%D7%A0%D7%95%D7%AA_%D7%94%D7%A2%D7%99%D7%A8%D7%99%D7%95%D7%AA_(%D7%9E%D7%9B%D7%A8%D7%96%D7%99%D7%9D)

evidence.title: The Second Legislation The Tender Obligation Act, 1993

indicators.justification:
The regulatory framework for accessing databases is mainly based on Government Decision 1933 from 2016. As part of the Government decision, the recommendations of the professional report on this matter were adopted.
The recommendations in the report, included mapping the public datasets and opening them. In addition, recommendations also include initiating activities to encourage the reuse of datasets. In practice, the government decision suffers from low implementation.
During 2021, the State Comptroller's published a report about the failures in implementing the government decision.Most of the encouragement for the reuse of datasets is sporadically.

(1) The goverment decision 1933 from 2016: Improving the transfer of government information and making government databases accessible to the public  https://www.gov.il/he/departments/policies/government_decision_1933_moch

Regulation that regulates the activity of local authorities is a law enacted prior to the establishment of the State of Israel and in accordance with the regulation in the field of information management in local authorities is irrelevant.
The promotion of digital in local authorities varies from authority to authority when it comes mainly from considerations of encouraging commercial activity and the efficiency of the authority and not from a perception of the importance or recognition of the value of providing services or access to information.

indicators.justification: In Israel, land has a unique identity that is a block and a plot. Corporations have a corporation number and individuals have an ID number. Political integrity data does not use any of the unique identifiers. If you refer to the area then usually only the name of the street will be indicated, if you refer to the corporation it will be the name of the corporation and if you refer to people then their name. Worse, there is no strict inscription of corporate names and therefore a computerized connection between the repositories is very problematic and requires an algorithm that knew how to deal with the biases and the result would not be reliable. In the case of people's names, then naturally many people share the same name and therefore it is also not possible to perform a cross.

Lobbying data and political finance data share common identifiers for lobbyist clients and party and campaign donors.
Lobbying registers and public consultation data use common identifiers for regulations.
Asset declarations and political finance disclosures share common identifiers for interests, assets, and liabilities.
The various datasets share common identifiers for legal persons associated with donations, interests, assets, liabilities, and lobbying activities.
The key datasets for the political integrity and company information modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The key datasets for the political integrity and land modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The key datasets for the political integrity and public finance modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The key datasets for the political integrity and public procurement modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.

indicators.justification:
The Accessibility Law defined the obligation to adjust accessibility, in service and physical facilities, towards public bodies and private bodies. In addition the law established the Commission for Equal Rights of Persons with Disabilities which is responsible for law enforcement.

The law also enacted secondary legislation for accessibility that explicitly defines the standards for making websites accessible and the data on them.

(1) Equal Rights for Persons with Disabilities Law, 1998    https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A7_%D7%A9%D7%95%D7%95%D7%99%D7%95%D7%9F_%D7%96%D7%9B%D7%95%D7%99%D7%95%D7%AA_%D7%9C%D7%90%D7%A0%D7%A9%D7%99%D7%9D_%D7%A2%D7%9D_%D7%9E%D7%95%D7%92%D7%91%D7%9C%D7%95%D7%AA

indicators.justification:
In Israel, there is no concept of sharing private information. If the information is protected by the Privacy Protection Law, 1981, its prohibit to share. If you wish to share, you should make sure that the information you share is not privte.The law does not reffer the way you should anonymize the data.

Chapter D of the Law (sections 23A to 23G) regulates the transfer of private information between public bodies. Such transfer should be by law. In addition, if it is a permanent transfer of information, the subject of the information should be informed. In addition, according to the Privacy Protection secondry legalization (Conditions for holding and storing information and arrangements for transferring information between public bodies), 1986 the public bodies should establish procedures, information security and approve any permanent transfer through an appropriate committee.

(1) The Protection of Privacy Law, 1981   https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A7_%D7%94%D7%92%D7%A0%D7%AA_%D7%94%D7%A4%D7%A8%D7%98%D7%99%D7%95%D7%AA

(2) Privacy Protection Regulations (Conditions for holding and storing information and arrangements for the transfer of information between public bodies), 1986
https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%AA%D7%A7%D7%A0%D7%95%D7%AA_%D7%94%D7%92%D7%A0%D7%AA_%D7%94%D7%A4%D7%A8%D7%98%D7%99%D7%95%D7%AA_(%D7%AA%D7%A0%D7%90%D7%99_%D7%94%D7%97%D7%96%D7%A7%D7%AA_%D7%9E%D7%99%D7%93%D7%A2_%D7%95%D7%A9%D7%9E%D7%99%D7%A8%D7%AA%D7%95_%D7%95%D7%A1%D7%93%D7%A8%D7%99_%D7%94%D7%A2%D7%91%D7%A8%D7%AA_%D7%9E%D7%99%D7%93%D7%A2_%D7%91%D7%99%D7%9F_%D7%92%D7%95%D7%A4%D7%99%D7%9D_%D7%A6%D7%99%D7%91%D7%95%D7%A8%D7%99%D7%99%D7%9D)

evidence.title: Privacy Protection Regulations (Conditions for holding and storing information and arrangements for the transfer of information between public bodies), 1986

indicators.justification:
Basic Law: Israel - the nation state of the Jewish people defined the status of the Hebrew language and gave a different definition to the Arabic language.
In practice, the information in Israel is published in Hebrew by default. Information services such as forms or information in Arab local authorities, are sometimes available in Arabic. This gap is not due to regulation but to the needs themselves.

Legislation and secondary legislation are published in Hebrew only. There is very partial publication in the Arabic language, emphasizing that the determining wording is the wording in Hebrew and the translation is intended to assist and is not binding.

(1) Basic Law: Israel - the nation state of the Jewish people   https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A7-%D7%99%D7%A1%D7%95%D7%93:_%D7%99%D7%A9%D7%A8%D7%90%D7%9C_%E2%80%93_%D7%9E%D7%93%D7%99%D7%A0%D7%AA_%D7%94%D7%9C%D7%90%D7%95%D7%9D_%D7%A9%D7%9C_%D7%94%D7%A2%D7%9D_%D7%94%D7%99%D7%94%D7%95%D7%93%D7%99

indicators.justification:
Budget Basics Law, 1985 sets out the budget structure and the ways in which the government spends money.

The state budget is approved by parliament as a collection of laws that define government spending, and accordingly require its publication. In practice, the budget department in the Ministry of Finance also publishes the budget as Excel files
https://data.gov.il/dataset/?q=%D7%AA%D7%A7%D7%A6%D7%99%D7%91

Tender Obligation Law, 1992 requires the state to purchase through a tender, unless there is an exemption, to publish the tenders and the exemptions from tenders
https://www.nevo.co.il/law_html/law01/242_001.htm

The government spends money through grants published on a dedicated website
http://www.tmichot.gov.il/BOE/OpenDocument/2011102027/OpenDocument/opendoc/openDocument.faces?logonSuccessful=true&shareId=0

The Government Freedom of Information Unit has established a procedure whereby all ministries and trust units must publish their procurement reports
https://www.gov.il/he/departments/news/expense_report
And it is published on the Freedom of Information website once a quarter
https://www.gov.il/he/Departments/DynamicCollectors/repository-of-answers?skip=0&Info=1

(1) The Budget Basics Law, 1985
https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A7_%D7%99%D7%A1%D7%95%D7%93%D7%95%D7%AA_%D7%94%D7%AA%D7%A7%D7%A6%D7%99%D7%91

(2) The Tender Obligation Law, 1992
https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A7_%D7%97%D7%95%D7%91%D7%AA_%D7%94%D7%9E%D7%9B%D7%A8%D7%96%D7%99%D7%9D

responses.subquestion_text: Are there laws, policies, or regulations requiring collection or publication of this information in any form?

responses.response_text: Requirements to publish data are set out in non-binding policy or guidance.
responses.subquestion_text: Do relevant laws, policies, regulations, or guidance discuss the publication of open data?
Summary reports must be provided as structured data.
Expenditure information at the most disaggregated level of the economic classification must be provided as structured data.
The rules/guidance require executive budget proposal information to be provided as structured data.
The rules/guidance require the approved or enacted budget to be provided as structured data.
The rules/guidance require in-year reports as structured data.
The rules/guidance require year-end reports as structured data.
The rules/guidance empower an agency or official to ensure the accurate and timely collection and publication of required data.
The framework requires a verification process.
The rules/guidance require that data is regularly updated.
The rules/guidance support the collection of structured data.

responses.response_text: They cover one or more central government agencies, but there are many agencies or local government units with weaker rules/guidance.
responses.subquestion_text: How comprehensive is the coverage of laws, regulations, policies, or guidance assessed for this question?

indicators.justification:
The content of the conflict of interest declarations and assets declarations is considered private information in Israel, and accordingly it is neither published nor provided in requests under the Freedom of Information Law. Section 7 of the Public Service Law (Capital Statement), 2016 also provides for confidentiality of assets statements. The Public Service Law requires the submission of assets declarations and other regulatory frameworks, as the Civil Service Regulations require that arrangements be made to prevent conflicts of interest.
In any case, there is no regulation on the structure of the data provided, and there is no publication of this information as a database.

(1) The Public Service Law (asset declaration), 2016

https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A7_%D7%A9%D7%99%D7%A8%D7%95%D7%AA_%D7%94%D7%A6%D7%99%D7%91%D7%95%D7%A8_(%D7%94%D7%A6%D7%94%D7%A8%D7%AA_%D7%94%D7%95%D7%9F)

(2) The Civil Service Regulations
https://www.gov.il/BlobFolder/policy/takshir_full/he/takshir-full.pdf

(3) The Civil Service (Appointments) Law, 1959

indicators.justification:
Sections 65-70 of the Knesset (Legislative Authority) Act, 1994, states the defenition of lobbying the obligations and regulations, including the publication of the information on the Parliament's website.

The framework contains clear and unambiguous definitions of lobbyists, lobbying clients, lobbying activities, and public officials.
The framework requires the collection and publication of the identities of lobbyists, lobbyist clients, and public officials who engage with lobbyists.
The framework requires the collection and publication of information on lobbyists' goals for lobbying activities.
The framework requires the collection and publication of information on timing of lobbying activities.
The framework requires the collection and publication of information on topics of lobbying activities.
The framework requires the collection and publication of information on how much money is spent on lobbying activities.

The framework requires a verification process.

indicators.justification:
The Party Funding Act, 1973 defines party funding, and the powers of the State Comptroller in this issues. The State Comptroller has established the guidelines of the State Comptroller under the Party Financing Act about
party financial management, 2009 which the reporting and collection of information is regulated by them. The reports themselves are made through a digital system of the State Comptroller and thus allow at least for the Comptroller to analyze the information. The visitor proactively publishes the data on his website.

(1) The Party Funding Act, 1973   https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A7_%D7%9E%D7%99%D7%9E%D7%95%D7%9F_%D7%9E%D7%A4%D7%9C%D7%92%D7%95%D7%AA

(2) The guidelines of the State Comptroller under the Party Financing Act about
party financial management, 2009

https://www.mevaker.gov.il/he/Laws/DocLib/law_m_miflagot_hanhayot_27.01.2009.pdf

evidence.title: The guidelines of the State Comptroller under the Party Financing Act about party financial management, 2009

indicators.justification:
Government decision 619 from 2020 dealt with the expansion of the infrastructure for public participation in the work of government ministries. In accordance with this government decision, a public participation unit was established in the Prime Minister's Office and a public participation website was established.
https://www.gov.il/he/departments/publicparticipation/govil-landing-page

In practice, it is important to say that public participation, which is usually done within the unit and the site, is voluntary public participation and not public participation out of regulatory obligation.

(1) The Government decision 619: Expanding the infrastructure for public participation in the work of government ministries

(2) The Freedom of Information Act, 1998

responses.response_text: There is no mention of data or the publication of data in relevant laws, policies, or guidance.
responses.subquestion_text: Do relevant laws, policies, regulations, or guidance discuss the publication of open data?
The framework requires the publication of notice of intent in advance of public consultation processes.
The framework requires the publication of proposed regulations.
The framework requires the timely publication of a full set of public comments generated through public consultation processes.
The framework requires reasoned responses to be published alongside comments.
The framework requires the publication of final regulations and justification.
The framework requires the publication of challenges to laws and regulations that have undergone public consultation processes, as well as their results.
The rules/guidance empower an agency or official to ensure the accurate and timely collection and publication of required data.
The framework requires a verification process.
The rules/guidance require that data is regularly updated.

indicators.justification:
Section 5 of the Freedom of Information Act requires the annual publication of a report. Sections 6-7 of the Freedom of Information Sub-Legislation specify what should be included in the annual report.
The directive for the delivery of information by the Freedom of Information Unit applies only to the government, and requires the provision of tabular information in a manner appropriate for processing.

(1) the Freedom of Information Act, 1998
https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A7_%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A4%D7%A9_%D7%94%D7%9E%D7%99%D7%93%D7%A2

(2) the Freedom of Information regulation, 1999
https://he.wikisource.org/wiki/%D7%AA%D7%A7%D7%A0%D7%95%D7%AA_%D7%97%D7%95%D7%A4%D7%A9_%D7%94%D7%9E%D7%99%D7%93%D7%A2

(3) The goverment decision 2950 from 2011: Implementation of the Freedom of Information Law, 1998: Increasing transparency in public authorities
https://www.gov.il/he/departments/policies/2011_des2950

indicators.justification:
The information about the companies is available and accessible on the DATAGOV website, and is updated frequently. This information includes a unique number for each company, which allows for a variety of uses and connections of the database to parallel databases (for example, government procurement).

(1) https://data.gov.il/dataset/ica_companies/resource/f004176c-b85f-4542-8901-7b3176f9a054

responses.response_text: One or more products/services exist, but they do not appear to make use of open datasets.

There is evidence of these products and services being promoted to, or used by, government.
There is evidence of these products/services being promoted to, or used by, civil society
There is evidence of these products/services being promoted to, or used by, the private sector.
There is evidence of these products and services being promoted to, or used by, media.
There is evidence that at least one of the examples cited is making use of beneficial ownership data.
At least one of the examples identified describes using artificial Intelligence or machine learning to process data
There is evidence that these uses have had or are having meaningful positive impacts.

indicators.justification:
There is no official source that centralizes information about the effect and impact that this information has.
The findings described are based on familiarity with the field and on sites of various organizations presenting their struggles.

responses.response_text: There are isolated cases of actors or entities using this kind of data to influence policy in the interests of more equitable land tenure and use.
responses.subquestion_text: Is there evidence of this data being used to influence policy in the interests of more equitable land tenure and use?
There is evidence of civil society organizations using data in this way.
There is evidence of media using data in this way.
There is evidence of academics using data in this way.
There is evidence of the private sector using data in this way.
At least one of the examples identified describes using artificial Intelligence or machine learning to process data

indicators.justification: There is a collection of news mentions of conflict of interest activities. In addition, the former Israeli prime minister is currently facing a criminal trial, among other things, on charges of conflict of interest activities that were prohibited in the conflict of interest arrangement.

responses.response_text: There are a number of cases of actors or entities using this kind of open data for accountability purposes.
responses.subquestion_text: Is there evidence of this data being used for accountability purposes?
Civil society organizations regularly use this data for accountability purposes.
The media regularly uses this data for accountability purposes.
Scholars or academic institutions regularly use this data for accountability purposes.
The private sector regularly uses this data for accountability purposes.
At least one of the examples identified describes using artificial Intelligence or machine learning to process data
There is evidence that these uses have had or are having meaningful positive impacts.

indicators.justification:
The most significant project based on open procurement data is "The Budget Key" operated by a non-governmental association. The project collects information on the budget structure, changes and implementation, tender data, budget supports and procurement reports, along with information on the corporations and provides a comprehensive picture.
https://next.obudget.org/?lang=en

Through it, organizations and journalists make extensive use of and investigate the government's financial activities.

responses.response_text: There is evidence that these uses are widespread, regular and embedded.
responses.subquestion_text: To what extent is there evidence of this kind of data use?
There is evidence of government procurement data being presented through data-driven dashboards.
There is evidence of government procurement data being used for red flag analysis.
There is evidence that government procurement data is being analyzed to improve access to procurement opportunities for marginalized groups.
There is evidence of government procurement data being analysed to support sustainable / environmental procurement.
There are examples of government using data in these ways.
There are examples of civil society using data in these ways.
There is evidence of private sector using data in this way
At least one of the examples cited appears to make use of open procurement data.
At least one of the examples identified makes use of open beneficial ownership data.
At least one of the examples identified describes using artificial Intelligence or machine learning to process data
There is evidence that these uses have had or are having meaningful positive impacts.
